body.div: $Shether$ He saied That Christe and baptisme did nothing <>
but washe awaye our originall synne; and if th<>
$n$ any man after baptisme did fall / he must
purchace remission of his synnes by pennance as
$Edmond brene; John Crosse; Thomas hollye; William Trigall; John Borden, Thomas Menys; Thomas Dilbdale; John Matson; William kenerday; William Morres; ffraunces Vyriall; John Seer$
$testes; Richard Alcocke; John Parker; William hogges; Robert ffoche; John Bayly; Walter Coffen; George Sorel; Petir Shorte.$ He saied that neither Almes deedes fasting neither
praiers dothe help the soule of man but faith oonly.
He that dothe trust to have any help by he prayer
of any creature or persone that ever god made
dothe committ Idolatry/ and dothe make hym an
ydell which is contrary to the commaundement of god.
$James Hardes; testes unicus.$ Is of the Saduce opinion denying the resurrection
of Christe in his Manhode. Saying that he rose
